Topic.Title: Small Apps You Can't Live Without

Posts.EditableText:
Well, not literally, but out of curiousity I want to know what small apps do you run/use on a daily basis that just make things ten times easier, more convenient or just "righteous and kickass" or "teh Rox0rz" as I know one of you would say it.

For me it would have to be [url=http://www.veridicus.com/tummy/programming/powermenu/:3as6axam]PowerMenu[/url:3as6axam]. This little app expands the functionality of right clicking apps running in the toolbar to include "always on top" and "minimize to tray" functions as well as sub-menus that allow you to change the priority and transparency of the application. It uses up barely any system resources, can run silently or sit in the system tray, and has yet to crash on me EVER after years of use. Great little app.

Anybody else got one?
